intro: Carrichtera vella, commonly known as the narrowleaf carrichtera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Carrichtera vella is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
